conclusion: Analyze the spatial arrangement of the objects and how their shadows change when the light source moves.
Objects are labeled A, B, C, and D, and their positions relative to the light source need to be considered.
The light source is positioned at the top left of the image.
When the light source moves, the shadows will shift accordingly.
The shadow of the light source will move to the right or left, depending on the direction of the light source.
The shadow of A will move to the right.
The shadow of B will move to the right.
The shadow of C will move to the right.
The shadow of D will move to the right.
When the light source moves, the shadows of the objects will shift to the right.
The shadows of the objects will move to the right when the light source moves to the back left or right.
